intro: Elaeodendron reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined elaeodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Its small, yellowish flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. The fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, aromatic pulp.
